result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C Drake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable as follows:  $50.00 per month, starting September 15, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
May serve in La Crosse County.  Sentence to start on or before September 25, 2015 at 6 pm.  AMENDED 9/27/15.  Sentence to start on or before October 2, 2015 at 6 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Dismiss but read in Counts 1 and 3.  Plead guilty to Count 2.  Joint recommendation for jail and court costs.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he plead to.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the plea, consitutional rights waived.  Court finds plea entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Defense stipulates as to a factual basis for the plea.  Court finds a factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.   Court ordered 45 days jail.    CC +  Domestic abuse assessment, DNA.  Credit for 12 days served.  Start on or before 9/25/15 at 6 pm.  May serve in La Crosse County.  Pay CC at $50/mo. starting 9/15/15.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-31-2015 01:30 pm

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: victim - F. G.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Must provide verifiable physical and mailing address before he may be released.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in person.  Reading of complaint waived.  NGP entered. PTC & STC dates set.  Attorney Fredrickson requested the bond be amended to a signature bond.  State argued for some cash.  Court ordered bond lowered to $150 with same conditions as previously ordered.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Corut advised the defendant of the  charges pending and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Court told defendant to contact SPD.  State requested $1000 cash bond.  Court ordered $500 cash bond with conditions.  AIA Set for 6/29/15 at 9:30 am.
